34#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
35# include "config.h"
36#endif
37
38#include <sys/cdefs.h>
39__RCSID("$NetBSD: openpam_get_feature.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:09 christos Exp $");
40
41#include <security/pam_appl.h>
42#include <security/openpam.h>
43
44#include "openpam_impl.h"
45
46/*
47 * OpenPAM extension
48 *
49 * Query the state of an optional feature.
50 */
51
52int
53openpam_get_feature(int feature, int *onoff)
54{
55
56 ENTERF(feature);
57 if (feature < 0 || feature >= OPENPAM_NUM_FEATURES)
58 RETURNC(PAM_BAD_FEATURE);
59 *onoff = openpam_features[feature].onoff;
60 RETURNC(PAM_SUCCESS);
61}
62
63/*
64 * Error codes:
65 *
66 * PAM_BAD_FEATURE
67 */
68
69/**
70 * EXPERIMENTAL
71 *
72 * The =openpam_get_feature function stores the current state of the
73 * specified feature in the variable pointed to by its =onoff argument.
74 *
75 * The following features are recognized:
76 *
77 * =OPENPAM_RESTRICT_SERVICE_NAME:
78 * Disallow path separators in service names.
79 * This feature is enabled by default.
80 * Disabling it allows the application to specify the path to
81 * the desired policy file directly.
82 *
83 * =OPENPAM_VERIFY_POLICY_FILE:
84 * Verify the ownership and permissions of the policy file
85 * and the path leading up to it.
86 * This feature is enabled by default.
87 *
88 * =OPENPAM_RESTRICT_MODULE_NAME:
89 * Disallow path separators in module names.
90 * This feature is disabled by default.
91 * Enabling it prevents the use of modules in non-standard
92 * locations.
93 *
94 * =OPENPAM_VERIFY_MODULE_FILE:
95 * Verify the ownership and permissions of each loadable
96 * module and the path leading up to it.
97 * This feature is enabled by default.
98 *
99 *
100 * >openpam_set_feature
101 *
102 * AUTHOR DES
103 */
104
